title: RCD - Regional Climate Downloader
summary: "The Regional Climate Downloader (RCD) is a web application designed to visualize and download data from our Thredds catalog. The RCD is more powerful and more complex than the RCCV. The Thredds catalog is essentially a disaggregation of all of the variables in our data sets into a form that optimizes access and downloading speeds. The RCD is capable of displaying all variables over all currently available time periods from the model runs and it can be used to download subsets of the model data that the user has selected by location, time period and variables." http://regclim.coas.oregonstate.edu/visualization/rcd/ Model Name (Name of the model, including acronyms): RDC - Regional Climate Downloader Model Version (Version of the model, [...]
body:
"The Regional Climate Downloader (RCD) is a web application designed to visualize and download data from our Thredds catalog. The RCD is more powerful and more complex than the RCCV. The Thredds catalog is essentially a disaggregation of all of the variables in our data sets into a form that optimizes access and downloading speeds. The RCD is capable of displaying all variables over all currently available time periods from the model runs and it can be used to download subsets of the model data that the user has selected by location, time period and variables."

http://regclim.coas.oregonstate.edu/visualization/rcd/

Model Name (Name of the model, including acronyms):

RDC - Regional Climate Downloader

Model Version (Version of the model, (i.e., 2.0)):

Abstract (Description or summary of the model, including its purpose or goals and the type or formalism of the model (e.g., system dynamic, agent based model, machine learning), preferably accompanied by relevant keywords):

"The Regional Climate Downloader (RCD) is a web application designed to visualize and download data from our Thredds catalog. The RCD is more powerful and more complex than the RCCV. The Thredds catalog is essentially a disaggregation of all of the variables in our data sets into a form that optimizes access and downloading speeds. The RCD is capable of displaying all variables over all currently available time periods from the model runs and it can be used to download subsets of the model data that the user has selected by location, time period and variables."

http://regclim.coas.oregonstate.edu/visualization/rcd/
